appearances.snippet: congresswoman lateefah simon, asserting that the president is selling the war to the american peoplender false pretenses and that congress must act. congress must reassert its constitutional power to declare war and rein in this administration. we must use every tool to hold this president accountable and to defend the principle that in the u.s. we do not let one man choose war. congressman eric swalwell, speaking to the media this afternoon, said that the next actions by congressional leaders will be crucial. >> when congress returns to washington on tuesday. we have to answer a simple question does congress check or cosign the president? >> and venezuela is currently under a level four travel advisory due to severe risk to u.s. citizens. the state department says no commercial flights are currently operating in or out of venezuela. u.s. citizens in venezuela are encouraged to establish multiple methods of communication. the u.s. government says it is unable to provide emergency services to u.s. citizens in venezuela. a reminder you can download the fox local app on your phone and s

appearances.title: ABC7 News 5:00PM : KGO : January 9, 2026 5:00pm-5:30pm PST
appearances.snippet: . >> coach k will be one of nearly a dozen speakers, including congress member lateefah simon, at a celebration of life saturday for the legendary football coach. pictures and posters of beam now decorate the entry halls of oakland's newly renovated henry j. kaiser center for the arts. john beam was shot and killed last november on campus at laney college, where he spent the last 20 years of his career. a 27 year old suspect remains in custody. >> i want it to be positivity. i want it to be, you know, how we live our lives, because that's what john would do, you know, he would tell you, you know, and it wasn't just a little good one liner, but i believe in you, so you can believe in yourself. >> 1400 people are expected to attend. an overflow room will be available, although in person tickets are sold out. abc seven will live stream the event starting at 2 p.m. coach k wants the message to be helping and supporting others the way beam did every day of his life. >> his former players, his former students. they're going to help people. that's what i'm hoping this can do, is catapult something so

appearances.title: KTVU Mornings on 2 : KTVU : January 11, 2026 7:00am-9:00am PST
appearances.snippet: . >> oakland mayor barbara lee, congresswoman lateefah simon, family members and former players weremong the speakers. coach beam is credited with developing more than 30 nfl players during his time at laney college and skyline high school, including seven super bowl participants. former oakland standout marvelle smith, who went on to win two super bowls with the pittsburgh steelers, says beams support never wavered. >> my very first championship that i won, coach beam and his family was right there on the field with me. so to come full circle and experience something like that with coach beam was, i mean, it's the pinnacle of achievements in my life, so to be able to experience that with him was truly a blessing. >> in oakland. betty yu, ktvu, fox two news. >> thank you betty. with the holidays over and winter setting in, some kids are feeling the seasonal blahs. what signs to watch out for and how? experts say parents can help out. >> and is this year's flu shot a good match to protect against what's going around? we'll speak live with an infectious disease specialist to talk about

appearances.title: CBS News Bay Area: Evening Edition 6pm : KPIX : January 10, 2026 6:00pm-7:00pm PST
appearances.snippet: >>oakland mayor barbara lee and congresswoman lateefah simon also talked about what coach beam meant to his community, especially the many players and students he impacted over the years. >>cindy, monica and sonia i love coach, one of the greatest, greatest lessons that he left me with was the example of how he fiercely loved his girls. and so i want to love and lift up my own two daughters in that same way. the same way that john loved you all. are you from the town? make some noise in this thing? yeah. you were so much more than a football coach. you were my hero, my mentor, and the most important person in my life. you believed in me before. i believed in myself. and that belief changed who i am. >>his daughters say while he passionately loved them, all his grandchildren held a very special place in his ■heart.his tragic death took away valuable time with his grandkids. but what coach beam stood for will be shared for generations to come. >>legacy isn't measured by trophies or titles. it's measured by who you show up for, who you believe in, who you protect, uplift, and love again
